text.content:
S: the patient is still feeling quite depressed.  She feels she has let her 
family down by getting worse yesterday.  She wants to get better and is 
frustrated with her setback.  She is nervous about seeing her family today but 
does realize they are going to be her greatest support.  She indicates she no 
longer feels suicidal.


PROBLEM LIST:
Computerized Problem List is the source for the following: 
 
1. Obesity, Onset 00/00/04                            05/30/12  AVIVAUSER,THIRT
2. Hyperlipidemia                                     09/22/09  PROVIDER,ONE 
3. Diabetes Mellitus Type II or unspecified, Onset    05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
00/00/05 
     Adequate control on oral medications.
     Goal to lose 50 pounds in 1 year.
4. Osteopenia, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
5. Postsurgical hypothyroidism, Onset 00/00/02        05/10/12  PROVIDER,ONE 
     Complete thryoidectomy for thyroid cancer in 2002.
6. Depression, Onset 00/00/08                         11/19/08  PROVIDER,ONE 
7. Hypertension, Onset 00/00/05                       11/09/08  PROVIDER,ONE 


MEDICATIONS (as listed in Vista):
  Active Inpatient Medications (excluding Supplies):
 
     Active Inpatient Medications                           Status
=========================================================================
1)   ASPIRIN TAB,EC  81MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
2)   CALCIUM CARBONATE TAB  500 MG PO TID                   ACTIVE
3)   CHLORTHALIDONE TAB  12.5 MG PO QDAY                    ACTIVE
4)   ERGOCALCIFEROL CAP,ORAL  1000 UNITS PO QDAY            ACTIVE
5)   GLYBURIDE TAB  2.5MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
6)   LEVOTHYROXINE NA (SYNTHROID) TAB  0.125MG PO QDAY      ACTIVE
7)   LISINOPRIL TAB  20MG PO QDAY                           ACTIVE
8)   SIMVASTATIN TAB  80MG PO QPM                           ACTIVE
9)   VENLAFAXINE TAB  75MG PO BID                           ACTIVE


VITAL SIGNS:
            B/P:  139/87 (02/24/2013 09:35)
          Pulse:  105 (02/24/2013 09:35)
    Temperature:  99.4 F [37.4 C] (02/24/2013 09:35)
   Respirations:  16 (02/24/2013 09:35)
         Weight:  241 lb [109.5 kg] (11/20/2012 16:31)
         Height:  64 in [162.6 cm] (11/20/2012 16:31)
            BMI:  41
           Pain:  0 (02/24/2013 09:35)

PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
  APPEARANCE:  NAD 

  EYE EXAM -

    LEFT EYE:  Not examined

    RYTHYM:     Regular

            INSIGHT: Fair
        ORIENTATION:

A/P:
1. Depression: Pt's thought processes are improved today, but she is still quite 
depressed.  We will continue the 1:1 sitter for another day.
text.author: AVIVAUSER,SEVEN
